Temecula Valley Council of Parent Teacher Associations (TVC PTA)
September 7 at 10:00 AM ·

Temecula Valley Council of PTAs, in collaboration with community stakeholders, will host a virtual Temecula Valley Governing Board Candidate Forum on Wednesday, September 30, 2020, beginning promptly at 6:00 P.M. While the event is free to attend, registration is required. Register via Eventbrite: https://tvcptacandidateforum.eventbrite.com

Candidates invited to participate are those running for open seats on the Temecula Valley Unified School District governing board in regions 1, 4, and 5. Candidates who are running without opposition are invited to participate in identical capacity to contested candidates to ensure the public is informed.

Questions from the public may be submitted via CandidatesForum@tvcpta.org. Questions may be submitted from September 1 – September 15, 2020. Questions received after 6:00 P.M. on September 15. 2020 will not be considered for use during the event. Questions from the floor will not be permitted during the event.

Please reach out to President@tvcpta.org with questions.

Tk-6 Waiver Update for Riverside County
Riverside County Public Health has been investigating the current number of COVID cases to determine whether or not they will begin accepting applications for the TK-6 waiver. They acknowledged that there were conflicting numbers out there so we have been awaiting clarification. On Friday, August 21 at 4:15 pm, a press statement confirmed that Riverside County is below the threshold and that the County Public Health Department will begin accepting waivers. It is important to note that there are many steps that must be taken in order to apply. TVUSD is aware of the process and we are taking steps to explore our options. We appreciate your patience and ask that you hold off on sending specific inquiries. We will update the staff and the community early next week as to our status, the steps, and the estimated timeline.

City of Temecula Community Services Department
June 3 at 11:00 AM ·

We will be offering the Summer Food Service program beginning June 9 – August 6, every Tues, Wed, and Thur at 11:00am at Margarita Community Park. Free healthy meals are provided to children and teens 18 years of age and younger while school is not in session. Due to the health and safety of participants, the meals will be non-congregate and served in a to-go setting. Quantity is limited and on a first come first served basis. This program is not intended for organized summer camps or programs. Parent and child must be present. For more information about Summer Food Service Program, visit http://fns.usda.gov/cnd/summer.

Please be mindful that next week is a transition week. We do not expect students and staff to hit the ground running on April 6. We need to establish now that there will be some hiccups and bumps. post_text:
Update - AC Issues at Some TVUSD Schools Today
Today, some TVUSD schools, identified by So. Cal Edison, not the District, had the AC turned off as part of the Summer Discount Program around 2:00 p.m. The District does not actually shut anything down or make the determinations. TVUSD has been enrolled in the Summer Discount Program for 8 years and has credited over $2 million to our electricity bills in that time. When the program is brought forward and evaluated, the main deciding factor previously has been that historically all events have been called AFTER SCHOOL hours and have had minimal impacts on school functions. Today's event has been an unprecedented outlier. We do believe that many other factors contributed to today's event including SCE's Public Safety Power Shutoffs due to anticipated winds. Please know that we annually evaluate the District’s participation in the program and until today, in 8 years, we have not had any significant issues.

Public Notice - TVUSD's Proposed 2019/20 LCAP and Budget Available for Review
The Temecula Valley Unified School District's proposed 2019/20 LCAP and 2019/20 Budget are available for public inspection as of Friday, May 31, 2019. A Public Hearing will be held on June 11, 2019, in compliance with Education Code 42103. Both the 2019/20 LCAP and the 2019/20 Budget is available for public inspection electronically on the District’s website, as well as in hard copy at the District’s Administrative Office, reception desk, through June 11, 2019. Following the public hearing on June 11, 2019, both items are scheduled for adoption by the Board of Education on June 25, 2019.

Anyone wishing to submit comments prior to the public hearing regarding the LCAP or Budget is encouraged to do so via the District’s Let’s Talk System. Please visit the LCAP website to review the draft documents and share your feedback. Please click on the link to access https://www.tvusd.k12.ca.us/lcap

Today, 8 students were recognized as Temecula Valley Chamber of Commerce Students of the Year! These 8 students were previously students of the month and through a community, judging process were selected as 2019 Students of the Year. Each student receives a $2,000 scholarship and a ton of goodies provided by local community donors. A special thank you to Sally Myers, owner of the Murrieta Sizzler. Sally began the Student of the Month program 27 years ago and continues to host valley-wide programs honoring students for character, academics, and service.
